result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Saldivar-Quezada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Advertising or Rental of Condemned Premises, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes ATCP134.09(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miguel Saldivar-Quezada in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead no contest.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 
As to Count 1:   Court ordered defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $684.00, to Lakeisha L., by 2-01-2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Defendant to pay a forfeiture in the amount of $1,200.00 including costs and surcharges at a rate of $100.00 monthly, commencing 01-01-2016, and the 1st of each month thereafter, until paid in full or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  The Court ordered no contact with Lakeisha L.  

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Miguel Saldivar-Quezada in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Ann Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived the interpreter for the purposes of today's proceedings.  Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Barnch 45.  On the record a date of 11/23/2015 was selected.  After the case was called, parties informed the Court that a new date was necessary and that new date was selected.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Miguel Saldivar-Quezada in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Anne Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also in court, previously sworn interpreter Brenda Bartholomew. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for one last pre-trial conference. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Miguel Saldivar-Quezada in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Parties request an adjourned pretrial conference. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lakeisha L.

Defendant Miguel Saldivar-Quezada in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Parties advised that effective August 1, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Grady, branch 23, room 515 in the Courthouse. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 06/25/2015.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-13-2015 at 01:30pm
